metadata.title: Add Hermes Agent - Open-Source AI Agent by Nous Research
metadata.description: Adds Hermes Agent — open-source, persistent AI agent framework by Nous Research. Supports Telegram, Discord, Slack, WhatsApp and CLI interfaces. Multiple LLM providers via OpenRouter. No official Docker image exists — compose stack builds from source using the provided Dockerfile.
metadata.author: Antigravity

operations.description: Add Hermes Agent as a compose stack (built from source — no official Docker image available)

template.title: Hermes Agent
template.name: hermes-agent
template.description: Open-source, persistent AI agent framework by Nous Research. Supports Telegram, Discord, Slack, WhatsApp, and CLI interfaces. Features sandboxed terminal execution (local/Docker/SSH), persistent memory, cron-based automation, and parallel subagent delegation. Connects to any OpenAI-compatible LLM provider.

env.name: OPENROUTER_API_KEY
env.label: OpenRouter API Key
env.description: API key for OpenRouter — primary LLM provider. Obtain at openrouter.ai. Can also use a direct OpenAI-compatible endpoint.

env.name: LLM_MODEL
env.label: LLM Model
env.description: Model identifier for inference. Use any model available through your configured provider.

env.name: TERMINAL_ENV
env.label: Terminal Backend
env.description: Execution sandbox for agent commands. 'local' runs inside the container, 'docker' spins up a nested Docker sandbox (requires Docker-in-Docker), 'ssh' delegates to a remote server.

env.name: TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN
env.label: Telegram Bot Token
env.description: Bot token for Telegram messaging integration. Leave empty to disable. Create a bot via @BotFather.

env.name: DISCORD_BOT_TOKEN
env.label: Discord Bot Token
env.description: Bot token for Discord messaging integration. Leave empty to disable.

env.name: SLACK_BOT_TOKEN
env.label: Slack Bot Token
env.description: Bot token for Slack messaging integration. Leave empty to disable.

env.name: SLACK_APP_TOKEN
env.label: Slack App Token
env.description: App-level token for Slack Socket Mode (required if using Slack).

env.name: GITHUB_TOKEN
env.label: GitHub Token
env.description: Personal access token for GitHub — used to access the skills hub and private repositories.

env.name: FIRECRAWL_API_KEY
env.label: Firecrawl API Key
env.description: Optional API key for Firecrawl web scraping tool.

env.name: CONTEXT_COMPRESSION_ENABLED
env.label: Context Compression
env.description: Enable automatic conversation context compression for long sessions.

template.note:
Hermes Agent nie posiada oficjalnego obrazu Docker. Stack buduje aplikację ze źródeł podczas pierwszego uruchomienia (docker compose up --build).

Krok 1 — Utwórz katalog projektu i skopiuj poniższe pliki:

Dockerfile
FROM python:3.10-slim
RUN apt-get update && \
    apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends git && \
    rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*
WORKDIR /app
RUN git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/NousResearch/hermes-agent .
RUN pip install -e '.[all]'
VOLUME /root/.hermes
ENTRYPOINT ["python", "cli.py"]

docker-compose.yml
services:
  hermes-agent:
    build: .
    container_name: hermes-agent
    env_file:
      - .env
    volumes:
      - hermes_config:/root/.hermes
    stdin_open: true
    tty: true
    restart: unless-stopped

volumes:
  hermes_config:

Krok 2 — Utwórz plik .env z kluczami API (patrz konfiguracja env vars powyżej).

Krok 3 — Zbuduj i uruchom:
docker compose up --build -d

Pełna dokumentacja: github.com/NousResearch/hermes-agent
